Articles.Content:
Hello,

I've been having an issue with tourists in my career save lately. I bring them to their destinations, but they are still marked as incomplete. The screenshot shows when I landed on Minmus with 4 tourists, but "Land on Minmus" didn't get completed. Please respond if you know what my problem is, how to fix it, any ideas as to what is happening, etc. Thanks!
Moved to Gameplay Questions as it's in fact a question about Game Mechanics, and not a Support Question.

Most likely one of your mods is messing with the contract system, but I don't have a good guess as to which one. Best bet is to make a savegame, disable all the mods, hop a meter off the ground, land again, and see what the contracts do. If they all get updated properly then add one mod back at a time, reload the savegame, and try the hop trick again -- until it fails. Then you know that the last mod you added was the culprit. Then report it all with a savegame and logfile to the maker of the mod.

Edited October 19, 2016 by bewing

59 minutes ago, bewing said:

... then add one mod back at a time, reload the savegame, and try the hop trick again -- until it fails...

Considering the number of mods visible, at least 75% of the time it would be quicker to add half, then add or remove half again depending on the outcome. Just sayin'

Thanks for the help everyone! What boggles my mind was that the "Fly by Minmus" objective was completed less than 10 minutes earlier with the exact same mods. But yeah, I'll try disabling mods and see what works.

Ok, I think I've narrowed down the problem, and I don't think I really needed to disable mods. I ended up transferring Jeb from the lander can to one of the orange inflatable pods. I then transferred a tourist from their USI Life Support cupola to the stock lander can, lifted the craft off the surface, then landed again. That tourist, and ONLY that tourist, then completed "land on Minmus." So it seems to be a problem with USI Life Support parts.

You'll need to shift everyone around again in Minmus orbit, since that too is not checked off in the screenshot.

Odd bug though.
I hope you don't have to go back and forth between orbital and suborbital to get those objectives to tick off, but you might.

I've had a slightly different issue where I've completed a tourist contract, but the tourists in question are still hanging around KSC and clogging up my astronaut roster.  

Will probably delete them from the save file at some point, but I'm tempted to arrange a tragic accident, possibly involving the use of rockets decoupled while live and aimed directly at their capsule.

Or maybe fly then to Nye Island on a sightseeing visit that gets a little too close to the antenna.
